ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: It's hard because the course topic is "meta." It isn't really about any topic, but it's mostly useful as a kick in the pants -- reminding, or revealing, how to play the academic game.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Getting to know my cohort.
Getting to know cohort; some academic and career advice/perspective; great class feedback on writing grant and fellowship applications.
Getting to spend time with other incoming FES PhD students and learn about the work they are doing.
It told us what are the requirements for a successful phd student.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I can't think of any areas for improvement.

I appreciated the introduction to philosophy of science through the first several readings, however, it might have been more compelling to read more seminal papers for discussion; eg Kuhn vs Popper or Hume.
I really wasn't all that fond of the time spent on the guest lecturers. It might have been more useful to meet FES faculty outside of our particular interest areas, rather than eminent strangers.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: It was great.
N/A

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This was the only class which brought the first year PhD students together, and was therefore, invaluable.
It is only generally related, about as useful as reading the Chronicle of Higher Education -- helpful as a regular reminder to make career progress, but not really furthering any specific content.
It is like an orientation.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: It was a requirement, so I signed up for it. But I am really glad that it was a requirement.
It is required.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes.
Yes, this was a great way to sound ideas and learn what work is being done within my cohort.
Yes and no. I guess I learned some unexpected things.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: n/a
N/A

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: It's a great to way to appreciate the diversity in your cohort, and to get to know them.
If you have a choice, write a fellowship or grant application, rather than a final project. It's what the course is best at.
